intro: Humboltia sirene, commonly known as the Sirene's humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a waxy texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Humboltia sirene is adapted to coastal environments, thriving in sandy soils and salty air.
